definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: Every time she gave him his medicine, he mutely kissed her hand, weeping .
sentences.chinese: 每次夫人给他递药，他总是抽泣，默默地吻她的手。

sentences.english: The condemned prisoner cowered and began to whimper for clemency.
sentences.chinese: 那个被判罪的囚犯抖缩着并开始抽泣请求宽恕。

sentences.english: The maid, still in tears, sniffed monotonously.
sentences.chinese: 侍女还在哭，发出单调的抽泣声。

sentences.english: He buried his head in her shoulder and wept.
sentences.chinese: 他把头偎在她的肩上，抽泣着。

sentences.english: She sobbed uncontrollably in O'Leary's arms.
sentences.chinese: 她在奥利里的怀抱里抽泣，无法自已。

sentences.english: She burst into a convulsive sobs.
When I spoke to them, I realised I was sobbing.
sentences.chinese: 当我和警察说话的时候，才意识到自己是边说边抽泣。

sentences.english: I ran from the dining room bawling. Up in my room I threw myself on the bed and sobbed.
sentences.chinese: 哭着冲出厨房，跑进房间，一头埋到床上，蒙头抽泣。

sentences.english: I had fallen into a chair, weakly snivelling.
sentences.chinese: 我已经倒在了椅子上，颤抖着，抽泣着。

sentences.english: Somehow this is skipped past, that--the sobs in the night.
sentences.chinese: 某种程度上这是被跳过的过去，就是夜晚的抽泣。

sentences.english: 'How did it happen, Peggotty?'I asked, sobbing.
sentences.chinese: “怎么会这样，辟果提？”我抽泣着问道。

sentences.english: I heard sobs on the other end of the phone line.
sentences.chinese: 我听见了电话另一头的抽泣。

sentences.english: On the contrary, it will strike deeper than the sobs.
sentences.chinese: 与此相反，它要比抽泣要更能打动人。

sentences.english: I wish that the rain would stop and let me cry in wain…
sentences.chinese: 我真但愿雨停下来，让我没希望地抽泣。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
